docs.abstract: It’s been a busy week in American politics. Here are some of the stories you might have missed.
docs.snippet: It’s been a busy week in American politics. Here are some of the stories you might have missed.
docs.lead_paragraph: From the trade war with China to escalating tensions over the Mueller report, it’s been a busy week in American politics. Here are some of the biggest stories you might have missed (and some links if you’d like to read further).

headline.main: On Politics: The Biggest Stories of the Week

docs.abstract: The United States and China paused their economic battle, and lawmakers considered postponing a fight over a spending bill to mourn a former president.
docs.snippet: The United States and China paused their economic battle, and lawmakers considered postponing a fight over a spending bill to mourn a former president.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Monday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: A Trade War Truce

docs.abstract: It’s been a busy week in American politics. Here are some of the stories you might have missed.
docs.snippet: It’s been a busy week in American politics. Here are some of the stories you might have missed.
docs.lead_paragraph: From new revelations in the Russia inquiry to the death of a president, it’s been a busy week in American politics. Here are some of the biggest stories you might have missed (and some links if you’d like to read further).

headline.main: On Politics: The Biggest Stories of the Week

docs.abstract: Senators said a closed C.I.A. briefing only solidified their belief that the crown prince of Saudi Arabia ordered Jamal Khashoggi’s killing.
docs.snippet: Senators said a closed C.I.A. briefing only solidified their belief that the crown prince of Saudi Arabia ordered Jamal Khashoggi’s killing.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Wednesday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: After Briefing, Senators Say Saudi Prince’s Guilt Is Clear

docs.abstract: Senator Cindy Hyde-Smith, who had to apologize for a cavalier reference to a public hanging, rebuffed Mike Espy’s bid to become the state’s first black senator since Reconstruction.
docs.snippet: Senator Cindy Hyde-Smith, who had to apologize for a cavalier reference to a public hanging, rebuffed Mike Espy’s bid to become the state’s first black senator since Reconstruction.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Wednesday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: Hyde-Smith Secures Her Mississippi Senate Seat in Win Over Espy

docs.abstract: Michael Cohen, President Trump’s ex-lawyer, admitted making false statements to Congress about negotiations during the 2016 campaign to build a Trump Tower in Moscow.
docs.snippet: Michael Cohen, President Trump’s ex-lawyer, admitted making false statements to Congress about negotiations during the 2016 campaign to build a Trump Tower in Moscow.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Friday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: Pleading Guilty, Cohen Details Moscow Trump Tower Talks

docs.abstract: In a combative appearance with Democratic congressional leaders, President Trump said that he would be “proud to shut down the government for border security.”
docs.snippet: In a combative appearance with Democratic congressional leaders, President Trump said that he would be “proud to shut down the government for border security.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Wednesday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: Trump Threatens Shutdown Over Funding for Border Wall

docs.abstract: President Trump traveled to the southern border to make his case for a wall, and Vice President Mike Pence shattered talk of a compromise with Democrats.
docs.snippet: President Trump traveled to the southern border to make his case for a wall, and Vice President Mike Pence shattered talk of a compromise with Democrats.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Friday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: White House Digs In on Wall Demands

docs.abstract: After a history of racist remarks, it was an interview with The Times that led Republicans to strip the Iowan of seats on powerful House committees.
docs.snippet: After a history of racist remarks, it was an interview with The Times that led Republicans to strip the Iowan of seats on powerful House committees.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Tuesday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: G.O.P. Turns on Steve King

docs.abstract: Senate leaders reached a bipartisan deal that could reopen the government for a few weeks, allowing the State of the Union address to move forward as planned.
docs.snippet: Senate leaders reached a bipartisan deal that could reopen the government for a few weeks, allowing the State of the Union address to move forward as planned.
docs.lead_paragraph: Good Wednesday morning. Here are some of the stories making news in Washington and politics today.

headline.main: On Politics: Senate Offers Glimmer of Hope for End to Shutdown
